1.text: The trumpet to thy mouth: as an eagle upon the house of Jehovah, because they passed by my covenant and they transgressed against my laws.

2.text: Israel shall cry to me, My God, we knew thee.

3.text: Israel rejected the good: the enemy shall pursue him.

4.text: They made kings, and not from me: and they made princes, and I knew not: their silver and their gold they made to them images to cut off.

5.text: Thy calf rejected, O Shomeron; mine anger was kindled against them: how long shall they not be able to be clean?

6.text: For from Israel, and this workman made it, and it is not God: for the calf of Shomeron shall be broken in pieces.

7.text: For they shall sow the wind, and they shall reap the whirlwind: no stalk to it: the sprout shall not make flour: perhaps it will make, strangers will swallow it down.

8.text: Israel was swallowed down: now they were among the nations as a vessel no delight in it.

9.text: For they went up to Assur, Ephraim a wild ass alone to himself: they hired those loving.

10.text: Also if they will hire among the nations, now will I gather them, and shall they be weak a little from the lifting up of the king of the princes.

11.text: Because Ephraim multiplied altars to sin, altars were to him to sin.

12.text: I will write to him his multitude of my instructions; they were reckoned as a strange thing.

13.text: The sacrifices of my gifts they will sacrifice flesh, and they will eat; Jehovah delighted not in them; now will he remember their iniquity, and he will review their sins: they shall turn back to Egypt.

14.text: And Israel will forget him making him, and he will build temples; and Judah multiplied fortified cities: and I sent a fire upon his cities and it will consume its palaces.
